intro: Catevala subattenuata, commonly known as the slender cat's eye, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue, arranged in spikes at the ends of the branches. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
